description: A possible Romano-British religious site, first excavated in 1913-14.
bibliography: Bagnall-Smith, Jean. “Interim Report on the Votive Material from Romano-Celtic Temple Sites in Oxfordshire,” 1995.

Fulford, M. G., S. J. Rippon, Denise Allen, J. R. L. Allen, S. J. Allen, Janet Firth, C. Gaffney, et al. “Lowbury Hill, Oxon: A Re-Assessment of the Probable Romano-Celtic Temple and the Anglo-Saxon Barrow.” Archaeological Journal 151, no. 1 (1994): 158–211. https://doi.org/10.1080/00665983.1994.11078122.
Martyn, Blick, Brindle, and et al. “Lowbury Hill (Oxfordshire).” The Rural Settlement of Roman Britain: an online resource, 2015. https://doi.org/10.5284/1030449.
